intro: Cusickia minor, commonly known as the small cusickia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or reddish in color. Cusickia minor is often found in desert scrub and grassland ecosystems, where it plays a minor role in local biodiversity.
